title: Comparison with the Inequality Operator
content: The inequality operator(!=) is the opposite of the equality operator. It means not equal and returnd false where equality would return true and vice versa. Like the equality operator, the inequality operator will convert data types of values while comparing.
Add the inequality operator != in the if statement so that the function will retrurn the string Not Equal when val is not equivalent to 99.

exercises.instruction: The compareEquality function in the editor compared two values using the equality operator. Modify the function so that it returns the string Equal only when the values are strictly equal.

hint: testNotEqual(99) should return the string Equal
testNotEqual('99') should return the string Equal
testNotEqual(12) should return the string Not Equal
testNotEqual('12') should return the string Not Equal
testNotEqual('bob') should return the string Not Equal
